page.title: 11Religion: FINTRY
page.content:
There has been a Kirk on the present site since 1207. the building used today dates from 1823.
The congregation belongs to the Church of Scotland, but all are made welcome. Such is the increase in Fintry's population that a new graveyard was sanctified on a site adjacent to the Kippen road. Only historically indigenous families may use the old graveyard surrounding the Kirk.
Catholic families worship either in Balfron or Lennoxtown. Anglicans use the Catholic church in Balfon once a month.
There is complete religious tolerance within the community.
